contentrichtext.text: {{for|the Pakistani economist|Mohammad Zubair Khan}} '''Zubair Khan''' (born February 7, 1983) was a British [[cricket]]er. Born in [[Birmingham]], he was a left-handed batsman and a right-arm fast bowler who played for [[Derbyshire County Cricket Club|Derbyshire]] during the 2000 season. Khan's brother, [[Rawait Khan]], is also a British cricketer. Both are of Pakistani background. His cricketing debut in the year 2000 was tentative, and he was never picked to play for the Derbyshire side again, accruing a strike rate of 120. ==External links== *[http://content-uk.cricinfo.com/england/content/player/15933.html Zubair Khan] at Cricinfo {{Persondata | NAME = Khan, Zubair | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = English cricketer | DATE OF BIRTH = February 7, 1983 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Khan, Zubair}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:English cricketers]] [[Category:Derbyshire cricketers]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Birmingham, West Midlands]]
